document_data.name: ''Candle of Truth''
document_data.mainbody: A '''''candle of truth''''' was a common [[magical item]] that created a [[zone of truth]] around it when lit.
document_data.Description:
''Candles of truth'' were white, half-pound (quarter-kilogram) candles made of tallow and enchanted with a ''zone of truth'' spell. They could burn for one hour and typically sold for 2,500 [[gp|gold pieces]].

A ''candle of truth'' gave of a faint [[enchantment]] aura.
document_data.Powers: When lit, the magic candle strongly compelled anyone within a five-foot (1.5-meter) radius to tell only the truth. The candle could only be used one time; if it was snuffed out, relighting it would not re-initiate the magic effect.
document_data.Creation: Anyone trained in the art of crafting wondrous magical items who also knew the spell ''zone of truth'' could create this type of item.
document_data.Notable Owners: The infamous adventurer [[Horlo Aumrabbar]] was in possession of a ''candle of truth''.
